thread.title: Hundreds of officers attend funeral for Illinois lieutenant
thread.title_full: Hundreds of officers attend funeral for Illinois lieutenant | News24

author: news24.com
title: Hundreds of officers attend funeral for Illinois lieutenant
text:
Antioch - Several hundred police officers from around the US attended a funeral on Monday for a suburban Chicago lieutenant shot and killed last week, and residents of the area turned out by the thousands to watch the hearse go by.
Charles Joseph Gliniewicz, who was 52 and on the cusp of retirement after more than 30 years with the Fox Lake Police Department, was shot and killed shortly after he radioed in that he was chasing three suspicious men on foot.
His more than kilometer-long funeral procession wound through small-town Fox Lake and lakeside forests that were the focus of a manhunt for the still at-large suspects. Fox Lake is a close-knit village of around 10 000 people and located about 80 km north of Chicago.
'You will never be forgotten'
